intro: Bryocles, commonly known as the false moss, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or white in color. The plant is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and often grows in moist, shaded environments. Bryocles species have a compact growth habit with hairy leaves and produce fruits that are capsules containing numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
